title: Court puts reinstatement of cannabis commission head on hold
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A judge ordered reinstatement of Shannon O'Brien as head of the Massachusetts Cannabis Control Commission, but the state appealed.
O'Brien was initially fired for alleged misconduct and other charges by State Treasurer Deborah Goldberg in September 2024.
Judge Robert Gordon's order is stayed temporarily; O'Brien’s attorneys have until Wednesday to respond to the state’s appeal.

title: Man charged with murder after woman, 38, found dead in Lynn, DA says
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Police found a 38-year-old woman dead on Newhall Street in Lynn early Sunday morning.
A 30-year-old Lynn man was arrested and charged with murder in connection to the woman's death.
The suspect is set to be arraigned in Lynn District Court on Monday morning.

title: Jakobi Meyers shuts down questions about trade request: ‘Happy to be a Raider’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jakobi Meyers expressed contentment with the Raiders despite a recent trade request being denied by the team.
Meyers caught eight passes for 97 yards in the Raiders' win over the Patriots, calling the game a homecoming.
The Raiders made significant changes in 2025, hiring Pete Carroll as head coach and signing Geno Smith as quarterback.

title: Tornado confirmed in Mass. town as powerful storm sweeps over region
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A tornado was confirmed in Holden by the National Weather Service during severe storms affecting the region on Saturday.
The NWS delayed a damage survey for the tornado, expected to assess path length, width, and severity on Monday.
Fallen trees and electrical line issues in Paxton and Holyoke caused blockages and power outages, but no injuries were reported.

title: In a season promising change, the 2025 Patriots looked all too familiar in season opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mike Vrabel's debut as Patriots head coach ended with a 20-13 loss to the Las Vegas Raiders.
Quarterback Drake Maye showed initial promise but stumbled in the second half, completing only seven passes for 51 yards.
Patriots' defense improved pressure with Harold Landry's 2.5 sacks but allowed nine 20-plus yard plays from the Raiders.

title: Will Campbell’s NFL debut was solid until things began to unravel late in the second half
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Will Campbell's NFL debut ended with struggles, as the Patriots lost to the Raiders 20-13.
Campbell made rookie mistakes in the second half, resulting in penalties and allowing two sacks.
Despite challenges, Campbell received praise from Maxx Crosby, who noted his potential and guidance under Coach McDaniels.

title: Lynn police officer on leave after becoming ‘suddenly incapacitated’ while on duty
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A Lynn police officer was placed on leave following a video showing him incapacitated during a traffic stop.
The department suspects a medical episode was involved and is investigating all potential contributing factors.
The officer was recorded struggling to respond and stand, leading to public concerns about drug or alcohol use.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled against the Raiders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots lost their season opener 20-13 to the Raiders, with Mike Vrabel debuting as new head coach.
Harold Landry III excelled with 2.5 sacks and several impactful plays in his Patriots debut.
Patriots struggled with the run game, totaling only 60 yards, as running backs underperformed.

title: Review & setlist: Dropkick Murphys come on strong, avert disaster at soggy Suffolk Downs
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: The Dropkick Murphys performed at Suffolk Downs despite a rain delay at the Seisiún Irish music festival.
A thunderstorm caused a lengthy delay, but dedicated fans returned to see remaining bands perform.
Dropkick Murphys energized the reduced turnout with a setlist featuring 'The Boys Are Back' and 'I'm Shipping Up To Boston'.

title: Bill Belichick explains ‘simple’ reason why he decided to ban Patriots scout at UNC
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bill Belichick banned a Patriots scout from UNC practices, citing an unwelcome environment at both facilities.
The decision follows a strained relationship between Belichick and the Patriots after his departure in 2023.
Patriots coach Mike Vrabel stated they'll find alternative ways to scout UNC players despite the ban.
